PR300.name: Public Relations Theory and Ethics
PR300.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
PR300.description: Theories of public relations, persuasion, social media interaction and mass communication as they apply to public relations, audience analysis and application of social media strategies. Theories of ethics, ethical codes in public relations and the ethical challenges in this field.

PR305.name: Methods of Public Relations Inquiry
PR305.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
PR305.description: Nature and conduct of public relations inquiry. Formative research methods, data analytics and evaluative measures used for public relations campaign planning. Drawing samples, collecting and analyzing data, interpreting and reporting results.
PR305.prerequisite: (ADV 260 or concurrently) and (MTH 101 or MTH 102 or STT 200)

PR310.name: Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion in Public Relations and Advertising
PR310.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
PR310.description: Exploration of issues pertaining to diversity, equity and inclusion (DEI) as they impact the practice of public relations and advertising within the United States and globally. Effective cross-cultural communication practices.

PR320.name: Public Relations Storytelling for Digital, Video and Print
PR320.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
PR320.description: Theory and application of storytelling for corporate and public relations purposes in the digital environment. Examination of established and emerging digital and social media platforms. Content creation for public relations purposes in established and emerging digital and social media platforms.

PR325.name: Intermediate Social Media and Public Relations Techniques
PR325.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
PR325.description: Production of social media and public relations messages to achieve strategic organizational communication objectives. Techniques for measuring success. Development of public relations portfolio.
PR325.prerequisite: (COM 300 or STT 200 or STT 201) or (PR 300 and PR 305 and PR 310)
PR325.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Public Relations Minor or approval of department.

PR335.name: Advanced Social Media and Public Relations Techniques
PR335.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
PR335.description: Advanced production of written, social media and video public relations messages to achieve strategic organizational communication objectives. Techniques for measuring success. Refinement of public relations portfolio.
PR335.prerequisite: PR 300 and PR 305 and PR 310 and PR 325

PR425.name: Public Relations Strategy and Ethics in a Digital World
PR425.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
PR425.description: Strategic planning and ethical considerations in public relations, social media and digital media.
PR425.prerequisite: (COM 300 or STT 200 or STT 201) or (PR 300 and PR 305 and PR 310)
PR425.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Public Relations Minor or approval of department.

PR485.name: Integrated Public Relations Campaigns (W)
PR485.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
PR485.description: Development of public relations campaigns for clients. Relationship-building, creative, social media and digital marketing communication elements.
PR485.prerequisite: (PR 300 and PR 305 and PR 310 and PR 320 and PR 335 and PR 325 and PR 425) and completion of Tier I writing requirement

PR492.name: Special Topics in Public Relations
PR492.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
PR492.description: Varied topics pertaining to the study of public relations processes. Not open to freshmen.

PR493.name: Public Relations Internship
PR493.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
PR493.description: Supervised public relations experience in a professional environment, under faculty supervision.

PR494.name: Public Relations Research Experience
PR494.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
PR494.description: Research experiences in various fields of emphasis in public relations under faculty supervision.
